intro: Wahlenbergia queenslandica, commonly known as the Queensland bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has hairy leaves that help it retain moisture. It produces small, capsule-like fruits containing numerous seeds. Wahlenbergia queenslandica is often found in sandy soils and is adapted to coastal environments with salt spray.
